item.title: Why Choose Dedicated Internet Access
item.description: By: John Shepler The Internet has transitioned from a novelty to a necessity, as indispensable as electricity or heat. However, its unreliability can be a source of frustration, especially given its immense potential for businesses. Let’s explore how to enhance Internet stability and dependability. Internet vs Internet Internet experiences are not universal, despite discussions about net neutrality claiming otherwise. While some enjoy superior performance, others face limitations. How is this possible?

item.title: Ethernet Better Than a T3 Line
item.description: By: John Shepler T3 voice and data lines, once a reliable option for businesses, now offer insufficient speed (45 Mbps) for modern demands, which often exceed 100 Mbps. Businesses today require significantly faster connections, with some even seeking speeds beyond 10 Gbps. If you’re still using a T3 line, you might find better bandwidth options at a similar or lower cost. What is a T3 Line? Developed by Bell Labs, the T3 line was designed to carry numerous simultaneous phone conversations, a function it still serves in certain settings.

item.title: Faster Internet Connectivity
item.description: By: John Shepler Faster internet speeds are generally preferred. While a select few enjoy seamless connectivity due to high bandwidth and low latency, most users remain limited by affordability and availability. However, there’s no need to settle for restricted internet speed without exploring the available options. The Internet Landscape Has Evolved One factor hindering faster internet adoption is complacency with existing providers. We might be content with a service chosen years ago, unaware of recent advancements.
